byline.contributor: Vindu Goel reported from San Francisco and Sydney Ember from New York.
byline.original: By VINDU GOEL and SYDNEY EMBER

abstract: Twitter reports slower-than-expected ad sales growth in its first quarter report, citing advertisers' reticence in spending on direct-response ads, a newer offering from the social networking company.
lead_paragraph: Twitter’s shares have been punished since it reported its earnings because advertisers and investors are having trouble figuring it out.

headline.main: Twitter Troubles Lie in Marketers’ Reluctance to Buy New Kind of Ad
headline.print_headline: Twitter Troubles Lie in Marketers’ Reluctance to Buy New Kind of Ad

snippet: Twitter’s shares have been punished since it reported its earnings because advertisers and investors are having trouble figuring it out.
